alert.note: Alert for Gloucester; Lancaster; Mathews; Middlesex (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 16 at 1:59PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Gloucester, southeastern Middlesex, northern Mathews and southeastern Lancaster Counties through 230 PM EDT... At 159 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Hartfield, or 8 miles west of Deltaville, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small trees and blow around unsecured objects. Wind impacting handling of high profile vehicles. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Deltaville, White Stone, Hartfield, Gwynn, Blakes, Dutton, Cobbs Creek, Wilton, Harmony Village, Grafton, Harcum, Cash, Amburg, Stampers, Wake, Foxwells, Hardyville, Pinero, Greys Point and Fort Nonsense. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong wind gusts are possible with these storms. These wind gusts are capable of knocking down tree limbs, small or weakened trees, and blowing around trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture, and other light outdoor objects. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for eastern Virginia.
